gauzy: a gauzy texture is often described as feeling light and airy and somewhat transparent or fuzzy.
a gauzy texture is soft and subtle often resembling delicate layers of fine fabric or misty haze.
meshed: a meshed surface is a layer of small particles or fibers arranged randomly and randomly throughout a material.
a meshed texture is a fabric or material with small threads woven together to create a fabric-like appearance.
cracked: a cracked texture is typically rough and uneven to the touch with visible cracks or fissures that allow light to pass through.
cracked material appears as broken or fractured surface.
stratified: a stratified texture is a layered or stacked pattern of different materials and materials with varying textures and colors.
a stratified surface has distinct layers of material.
scaly: a scaly texture appears as thin raised lines or ridges covering the skin of some animals.
a scaly texture is rough and often resembles the skin of a reptile or a fish.
swirly: a swirly surface has swirling patterns of water or air
a swirling mixture of different colors can be observed on the surface of water when a storm is passing.
perforated: perforated material appears as thin and flexible strips with holes in them that allow the material to pass through while keeping its integrity intact.
perforated material appears as a thin strip of holes of varying size that penetrate the surface of a material.
pleated: a pleated texture is usually characterized by being folded and creased into many small folds that give the fabric a soft and slightly distorted appearance
pleated material is a fold of fabric with multiple layers of fabric that are gathered or pleated in a way that creates a layered or pleated effect.
flecked: flecked material appears as irregular patches of color varying in intensity on a surface.
a flecked surface is characterized by scattered specks or tiny particles that are evenly distributed and lack a uniform color.
fibrous: a fibrous surface is characterized by a network of slender fibers or filaments that cover its entire texture.
a fibrous texture is characterized by a network of long thin strands or fibers.
polka-dotted: polka dots are small rounded spots of color on a surface, they can be found on fabric, paper, or other materials, and often have a playful or whimsical appearance.
a polka dotted surface has small dots scattered across its entire area.
chequered: a chequered surface is typically characterized by the presence of alternating stripes or patches of different colors usually black and white.
chequered material has a distinctive appearance with squares of different colors.
blotchy: blotchy material resembles uneven or patchy texture.
a blotchy surface usually appears as a mixture of bright and dull colors on the skin, with patches of discoloration or uneven pigmentation that can be raised or flat.
stained: stained material appears as discoloration on surface usually.
a stained texture is often characterized by discoloration and uneven color distribution.
crystalline: a crystalline texture is often characterized by being smooth and unbroken.
a crystalline surface has a flat and smooth appearance typically with a reflective or transparent appearance.
porous: porous materials have many holes and gaps inside them.
a porous texture is often seen in plants with many small holes or cracks where water can easily pass through.
banded: a banded texture is often seen in patterns with multiple bands of color or pattern that are evenly spaced and parallel to each other.
a banded texture is a pattern with repeating stripes in the same color that appear in a grid pattern on a surface.
lacelike: a lacelike texture is often described as being smooth and shiny like fine silk or velvet.
a lacelike texture is formed when fibers are woven together closely.
sprinkled: a sprinkled texture resembles a combination of small bumps and tiny dots on a surface.
sprinkled material resembles scattered grains of dust.
bubbly: a bubbly surface appears with a thin layer of soap bubbles, they rise to the surface, and slowly lose their air, leaving a clean and calm surface.
a liquid substance with a frothy, fluffy, and soft appearance is described as having a bubbly texture.
lined: a lined surface is typically created with a ruler or a straight edge drawn across the surface of a sheet of paper or other material to create a straight line.)
a lined surface is a flat piece of material often made of paper or cardboard with a smooth edge and a slight crease where the edge meets the surface.
veined: veined material appears as a mixture of solid and liquid components, often appearing as streaks or lines within a larger surface area, sometimes visible to the naked eye.

veined material appears to be streaked or broken in places with fine or thin lines of color in others. 

.
bumpy: a bumpy texture can be somewhat rough and uneven in appearance.
bumpy material appears as rough unevenly textured surface.
paisley: paisley patterns are typically characterized by a symmetrical design featuring repeating motifs of flowers and leaves in a specific arrangement.
paisley is a type of printed fabric often featuring intricate floral patterns that are typically circular in shape.
potholed: a potholed surface is a road with deep cracks and bumps on the road's surface.
potholed material resembles a rough combination of rocks and gravel often found along roadsides.
waffled: waffled material has a rough texture.
a waffled surface is one with a roughened and uneven texture that resembles the surface of a waffle iron.
pitted: a pitted texture is characterized by a rough surface that is often caused by mechanical damage or chemical etching.

pitted material often appears as rough, irregular, and porous surface.

.
frilly: frilly fabric is often soft and pastel colored delicate and dainty usually with intricate patterns and textures.
a frilly texture looks like soft and layered material with delicate and lacy patterns.
spiralled: spiralled material appears to be twisted or curled into a spiral shape while being processed.
a spiralled texture is a wavy, curved pattern often found in things like spun sugar, twisted pipe cleaners, or even some types of leaves.
knitted: a knitted surface is often soft and flexible.
a knitted texture resembles a woven pattern created by interlacing rows of loops
grooved: a grooved surface is a raised pattern created by cutting into the surface of a material using a rotating cutting tool.
a grooved surface is a raised pattern created by cutting into the surface of a material using a rotating cutting tool.
dotted: dotted material is dots and lines that intersect with each other at a slight angle.
a dotted surface is typically a flat plane that has small, closely spaced depressions in it.
interlaced: a typical interlaced surface resembles a folded or crumpled material with parallel layers stacked on top of each other.
a texture that has interlaced or crossed patterns.
crosshatched: a crosshatched surface is characterized by a pattern of intersecting lines that create a textured and layered appearance.
crosshatched material consists of interwoven lines and patterns created by cutting or scratching the surface of a material like wood or fabric.
wrinkled: a wrinkled surface can be seen as a surface that is creased or torn and has lost its smooth texture.
wrinkled texture appears as deep folds on fabric usually.
smeared: smeared material appears as a thin and blurry discoloration on surfaces when it is applied in excess.
smeared material is a liquid or semi-liquid substance that has been contaminated with a substance or agent that has penetrated into it, resulting in an uneven and diffuse appearance.
striped: striped material is typically a pattern of small, evenly spaced bands of color on a background fabric usually cotton or synthetic.
a striped surface appears to have horizontal white stripes on it.
braided: braided material is typically twisted or woven strands of different thicknesses and textures often arranged in a specific pattern.
a braided texture is a intricate pattern of interwoven threads or strands.
freckled: a freckled surface is typically a combination of small brown or tan spots or patches scattered across the skin.
freckled material resembles uneven patches of light brown skin.
cobwebbed: cobwebs are fragile and delicate threads of silk or spider silk that cling to surfaces often found in damp or humid environments.
a cobwebbed texture appears dull and faded with fine threads scattered across the surface.
honeycombed: honeycombed is a porous and irregular structure.
a honeycombed surface is characterized by small hexagonal holes scattered across its entire exterior evenly distributed on every surface.
woven: woven material is typically made from fibers such as cotton or polyester that are processed together to create a strong and durable fabric.
a woven surface is typically created by interlacing threads or fibers in a repetitive pattern.
matted: a matted surface is typically covered in long tangled hair.
a matted texture is when hairs or fibers become tangled and knotted together so tightly it creates a rough and irregular surface.
zigzagged: zigzagged material has a wavy or irregular texture with a mix of smooth and rough sections.
zigzagged material consists of layers of intertwined strips of various colors and textures.
marbled:
a marbled surface appears to have a layered appearance due to the way the different colors or materials are mixed together in a certain way.

.
a marbled surface is characterized by a mixture of different colors or shades of the same color creating a pattern of varying degrees of intensity or darkness and lightness.
studded: studded material consists of hard or rough-textured objects.
a studded surface appears as a textured, rough, and often shiny exterior often formed by a series of small, pointed or rounded protrusions.
grid: grid material usually consists of a set of small interlocking tiles that are rectangular in shape and typically made of metal, concrete, or glass.
a grid texture is typically created by repeating horizontal or vertical lines of different colors or patterns at a regular distance from each other.
